result.execSummary:
The defendant Matao J Noblin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Huber with standard release conditions.
Apply 24 days sentence credit, if revoked.

miscConds.notes: Cash bail applied.  Balance of restitution is order to be paid (joint and several with the co-actor) to the victim as a Condition of Probation.  To be paid BEFORE costs/fines/surcharges within the first year of probation.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.
Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No contact with Amy Koebisch, Michael Bricko, Jr. nor his residence, apartment building located at 120 Cambridge Avenue in the City of Waukesha.
No contact with any of the co-actors, Jennifer Snowden nor the apartment building at 1701 Elder Street in the City of Waukesha.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

Court costs and DNA surcharge are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes:

LAST 60 DAYS STAYED - To be used at Agent's discretion.

Huber with standard release conditions.

records.addlTxt:
Notice of Case Status Change - Revoked - Sentenced to Jail/HOC
  Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been converted to a civil judgment.
Impose 35 days Condition Time with Huber (release for education and employment).
Filed by DOC Agent Daniel Pavelko, requesting the court impose the 35 day condition time, including proposed Amendment to Judgment of Conviction.
Received and filed in court by the State.

Lindsey Hirt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Matao J Noblin in court with attorney Katie B. Bricco.

State presented their sentencing recommendations.
Defense presented their sentencign recommendations.
Defendant presented statements to the court.



Court orders the following:
Count 1:
9 Months in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions).
24 Days Credit.
STAYED.
 
Term of Probation:  24 Months.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No contact with:  Amy Kaebisch, Michael Bricko Jr. nor his residence, apartment building located at 120 Cambridge Avenue in the City of Waukesha, Co-Actors, Jennifer Snowden nor the apartment building at 1701 Elder Street in the City of Waukesha. 
DNA sample to be provided.

Restitution: $220 joint/several with co-actors(to be paid to the vicitm (A.K.) listed in the criminal complaint - To be paid first then costs/fines). - To be paid within the first year of probation.
Costs:  $243
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $200
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

CONDITION TIME: 
90 Days in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions).
First 30 Days to be served.
Last 60 Days - STAYED - To be used at agent's discretion. 

Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.




Count 2:
90 Days in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions).
Consecutive to: Count 1
STAYED.
 
Term of Probation: 24 Months
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
Same as count 1.

Costs: $243
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.


Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.

Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.
